[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContractState.cs] [State: ConnectorController] [Contract Address Mismatch] Can ConnectorController.Value.ContractAddress point to a different contract than OwnerAddress expects, causing authorization checks to fail or be bypassed? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContractState.cs] [State: MethodFeeController] [Unused Controller Risk] Since MethodFeeController is declared but never accessed in contract code, can this create authorization gaps if ACS1 method fee logic attempts to use it? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContractState.cs] [State: All States] [Reentrancy via State Reads] Can external contract calls (TokenContract.Transfer, DividendPoolContract.Donate) during Buy/Sell/HandleFee read stale state values if those contracts call back into TokenConverter before state updates complete? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContractState.cs] [State: FeeRate + DepositBalance] [Fee Accounting Gap] If FeeRate changes between Buy calculation and HandleFee execution, can the fee deducted from user not match the fee added to DepositBalance, creating accounting holes? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContractState.cs] [State: DividendPoolContract Reference] [Fee Diversion Attack] If DividendPoolContract.Value can be changed after initialization, can an attacker redirect all fee donations from HandleFee to their own contract? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContractState.cs] [State: Connectors] [Symbol Length Attack] Can extremely long Connector.Symbol strings cause storage DOS or excessive gas consumption when used as MappedState keys? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContractState.cs] [State: FeeRate] [Culture-Specific Parsing] Since FeeRate uses InvariantCulture for ToString but GetFeeRate() uses default decimal.Parse, can culture differences cause parsing failures or value corruption? (Low)
